meanings.definition: To silently articulate words while reading or speaking.
meanings.sent1: I subvocalize the text as I read to better understand it.
meanings.sent2: She subvocalizes the lyrics of the song to remember them.
meanings.sent3: He likes to subvocalize the menu items at the restaurant for fun.
meanings.sent4: The students subvocalize the answers during the exam to avoid distractions.
meanings.sent5: Subvocalizing the instructions helps me follow them accurately.

meanings.definition: The act of forming words in the mind without vocalizing them.
meanings.sent1: His subvocalize helps him remember information better.
meanings.sent2: The subvocalize of the poem stayed with her long after she read it.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious subvocalize in her head made her feel like a secret agent.
meanings.sent4: The subvocalize of encouragement kept her going during the race.
meanings.sent5: The calming subvocalize of the waves helped him relax.

meanings.definition: To mentally pronounce words without making any sound.
meanings.sent1: I subvocalize the dialogue in the book to feel more connected to the characters.
meanings.sent2: She subvocalizes the names of the constellations as she stargazes.
meanings.sent3: He likes to subvocalize the lyrics of his favorite songs in the shower.
meanings.sent4: The actor subvocalizes his lines backstage before going on stage.
meanings.sent5: Subvocalizing the recipe steps helps me remember them while cooking.
